page.title: 01Day in life of a farm boy.
page.content: {Day in the life of Martin Davies,} August 17th 1984 My day started early at 7.30 am. I went out to suckle 4 'Charolais' calves(a French breed introduced some years ago), on 2 Hereford and Friesian cows. I then fed the Hereford bull, a specail interest of mine. As soon as the dew lifted we were combining 7 acres of spring Barley variety kym. I then cleared 30 sacks which would be required for seed next year.Our Massey Ferguson combine was working quickly. The corn bin at the farm was almost full, so I then had to level corn as it came out of the auger. We started bailing straw, which was left behind the combine. I stacked the straw bails into flat eights,which were loaded onto the trailer. At the end of the day 759 bails were stacked.
